intro: Cerastium fontanum subsp. lucorum, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features prostrate or ascending stems that are often covered in dense, soft white or grayish hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers clustered in umbels, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are opposite, broadly ovate, and covered with a fine layer of silky hairs. It thrives in well-drained, rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine meadows and scree slopes.
